a1: Revenue is estimated by multiplying views (in thousands) by the CPM (cost per mille) rate. Actual earnings depend on niche, audience location, and ad engagement.
q2: What is a good CPM rate?
a2: CPM varies widely: $1-3 for entertainment, $5-15 for finance/tech, $10-30 for B2B content. US/UK audiences have higher CPMs.
a3: These are estimates only. Actual YouTube revenue depends on many factors including ad types, audience demographics, and YouTube's revenue share (typically 55%).
